oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MECHANISM AND ESTIMATION OF SEDIMENTATION IN BANGKOK BAR CHANNEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Deguchi, Ichiro
Sawaragi, Toru
Ono, Masanabu
Koontanakulvong, Sucharit
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: channel
bar channel
sedimentation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mechanism of sedimentation in Bangkok Bar Channel in Thailand is investigated by using the periodically measured water depth around channel, dregded volume and the relation between discharged sediment concentration and discharged velocity measured at the river mouth of Chao Praya. Simple numerical simulations for predicting sedimentation volume in the channel are also carried out. The results show that both discharged sediment from the river and sedimentation around Bangkok Bar caused by waves and current play an important role in the sedimentation in the channel.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
